overview.format: line-delimited JSON (.alp). Each line is one JSON object.
overview.execution: Linear traversal of @flow.edges in file order. Each edge is [src, dst, meta]. If meta.when is truthy, dst executes with src output as inbound.
overview.validation: Outputs are validated against @expect.type shapes; defaults applied before validation; result may be synthesized from env to satisfy shape fields.
overview.arg_resolution: $name and $dotted.path resolution inside @op args and @llm.input. Resolution is recursive within lists/objects.
overview.bindings: Each @op may include third metadata object {"as":"name"} to bind the op result in env.
overview.env_exposure: $result holds last op result; if result is numeric or has a numeric field "value", that value is also exposed as $value.
overview.stable_vocab: VM accepts either text tokens (@shape,@fn,...) or their SDK-shipped concept IDs (CIDs). CIDs are stable hashes mapped to canonical tokens.

@shape.fields: object mapping fieldName -> type. Optional fields end with '?'. Enums via enum<...>. Collections supported.
@shape.defaults: optional object of default values applied before validation

@fn.@const: object injected into env prior to ops (optional)
@fn.@op: array of [name, argsObject, meta?]. meta may contain { as } for bindings.

@llm.input: object (resolved with $) or uses inbound when empty

@flow.meta.when: conditional expression (see conditions) controlling whether the destination executes

conditions.operands: scalars or $paths into the previous node's output
conditions.truthy: a string $path by itself is coerced to boolean

ops.name: calc_eval
ops.notes: Supports +,-,*,/,//,%,**, parentheses, unary +/-, and '^' as exponent.

ops.name: map_each
ops.notes: Calls function 'fn' for each item; if 'param' provided, wraps inbound as { param: item }

ops.name: write_file
ops.security: Requires ALP_IO_ALLOW_WRITE=1 and path under ALP_IO_ROOT

ops.name: http
ops.security: Requires ALP_HTTP_ALLOWLIST; local/private hosts blocked unless ALP_HTTP_BLOCK_LOCAL=0

ops.name: json_get
ops.notes: Dot path supports object keys and integer list indices

llm.behavior: When provider=mock, the VM synthesizes JSON that conforms to the requested schema; real providers are called with strict JSON-only prompts and validated.
llm.retries: @retry.max controls retry attempts on validation failures

io_and_http_sandbox.ALP_IO_ROOT: filesystem root for read/write operations (default: CWD)
io_and_http_sandbox.ALP_IO_ALLOW_WRITE: 1 to enable write_file, else writes are blocked
io_and_http_sandbox.ALP_HTTP_BLOCK_LOCAL: 1 (default) blocks localhost/private IPs; set 0 to allow

debug.ALP_EXPLAIN: 1 to print env snapshots after each op to stderr

resolution_rules.dollar_paths: $name and $a.b.c traverse env dicts; when traversing non-dicts, only 'value' is special-cased to allow $value to read numeric results.
resolution_rules.recursive_args: Lists and nested objects are recursively resolved
resolution_rules.inbound_binding: If a function declares inputs and inbound is provided, the VM maps inbound to declared names. If only one input is declared and inbound is scalar, it binds directly to that name.
resolution_rules.synthesis_before_expect: If @expect.type is declared and result is not an object, the VM will synthesize a result object using env keys that match shape field names before applying defaults and validating.

row.env: optional map of env vars for this test
row.expectKeys: array of dot-paths that must exist in the output
row.expectContains: object of dot-path -> substring that must be contained in the string value
